result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence M Craigg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IF DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES ALL CONDITIONS OF PROBATION, expungement will be granted.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.   
Pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments & surcharges while on Probation.  
Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Maintain full-time employment.  
If defendant is in school, he may work part-time.    
Obtain GED or HSED program.

NO alcohol.   
NO controlled substances without a valid prescription.      
NO association with know drug users or drug dealers.
NO CONTACT with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. 
NO CONTACT with the law that rises to arrest.
Any other programs or treatment agent deems appropriate.

AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs fees, surcharges & assessments by 10-29-15.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments  Failure to pay is civil judgment.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence with Huber for work, meeting with agent or school. 
REPORT-IN DATE Monday 11-03-14 by 5:00 p.m.  If defendant fails to report, ALL community access is denied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence M Craigg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: subpoena

Defendant Lawrence M Craigg in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, meeting with agent, and school.

Report in Date: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 3, 2014, by 5 PM.  If defendant fails to report, all community access is cancelled.

- Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 10/29/2015.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court gives credit for 0 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month.  
- Obtain GED or HSED program.
- Maintain full time employment.  If defendant is in school, he may work part time.
- Not use or possess any firearm.
- Any other programs or treatment agent deems appropriate.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- NO contact with the law that arise to arrest.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation.  Cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

IF DEFENDANT SATISFACTORILY COMPLETES ALL CONDITIONS OF PROBATION, EXPUNGEMENT WILL BE GRANTED.


AS TO BOTH COUNTS:

Defendant Lawrence M Craigg in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 IN THE AMENDED INFORMATION:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  
CASE PASSED TO 1:30 PM.  aw

Received and filed.  aw

Count 1:  Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols (THC), contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(e).  A unclassified misdemeanor.

Count 2:  Carrying a concealed weapon, contrary to WI Stats sec. 941.23(2), 939.51(3)(a).  A class A misdemeanor.  aw

Defendant Lawrence M Craigg in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Lawrence M Craigg in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03. Court ordered to not enter not guilty plea to misdemeanor count 2 on behalf of the defendant for this hearing ONLY due to possible substitution.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
